newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian violence takes another 16 lives.
newsitem.headline: Colombian violence takes another 16 lives.

text.p: At least 16 people, most of them apparent victims of right-wing paramilitary groups, were killed in the latest wave of political violence across Colombia, authorities said on Wednesday.

Military spokesmen and police said the victims -- all of whom were killed between Tuesday and early Wednesday -- included the mayor of a small town in central Boyaca province and five peasants gunned down on a farm in northern Sucre province, the site of a rash of killings attributed to rightist death squads over the weekend.

Other victims of suspected paramilitary groups operating across the country included three peasants shot and killed in an attack in northwestern Antioquia province and three people whose bullet-torn bodies were found late on Tuesday outside the Caribbean port city of Cartagena, Colombia's prime tourist resort.

Two of the people killed in the 24 hours ending early on Wednesday were believed to be the victims of leftist guerrillas, including a rancher who was shot and burned to death in Antioquia. Two others were guerrillas who died in combat in northern Norte de Santander province, authorities said.
They said the latest fatalities had raised the death toll from political bloodshed since last Friday to more than 60.
